posts.title: Stocks fall as Trump warns of US economy trade war 'transition'
top_comments: President of “No Wars” begins his second term by starting a Trade War. More news at 11
Tesla down 15% today alone is crazy. Wipes out every gain they made from November.
Trump, contrary to polls, is very bad for our economy.
the great businessman who had 6 bankruptcies ladies and gentlemen.  🎩

Transition TO WHAT?   Financial ruin, destroyed partnerships, vaporized supply chains, never retiring, and blown investments?

This guy is the dumbest sack of Matlock reruns I have ever seen.
Already tired of all this … winning?
We've almost given up 6 months of stock growth. The stock market isn't the economy, but when stocks slump, the real economy slumps.

just to be clear, when Biden left office we had +2.3% GDP growth. Trump has been in office less than two months and we are now projected to have -2.8%. in TWO FUCKING MONTHS he destroyed 5% GDP. fuck you if you voted for this fascist dictator.

In case anyone is wondering where we've been and where we're going, here's a handy guide.

1. The tariffs are great for the economy
2. The tariffs are great for the economy, but it will take time to see
3. The tariffs will be good overall for America, but the economy will "transition" **<-- (you are here)**
4. This is a market correction, not a recession
5. Not *all* experts agree that we're in stagflation
6. This depression is all because of the Biden/Obama tariffs which I, Donald Trump, will now end!
Thought he was against transitioning

posts.title: Washington Post editor resigns after accusing CEO of killing column
top_comments: “Will’s decision to not run the column that I wrote respectfully dissenting from Jeff’s edict — something that I have not experienced in almost two decades of column-writing — underscores that the traditional freedom of columnists to select topics they wish to address and say what they think has been dangerously eroded,” Marcus wrote in her resignation, according to The New York Times.

If I've said it once, I've said it a thousand times. 

The true value of owning a newspaper is controlling the narrative and silencing opposition.

It doesn't matter to Jeff Bezos how many subscribers or ad clicks he has. He can *lose* money on the newspaper and it's still more valuable than not owning it. This way, he gets to drive a specific narrative specific to his own agenda while attaching a (formerly) prestigious publication to it. 

He doesn't care about journalism. He cares about his money and power.

The days of legacy Journalism are over.

>Bezos, the Amazon founder who purchased the venerable publication in 2013, told the staff last month that the opinion section would take a radical turn by "writing every day in support and defense” of “personal liberties and free markets."

"From now on you'll print *my* opinion - daily" - American oligarch and owner of the Washington Post
People need to cancel, there is no way one can trust anything from the Washington post now
I regret that I HAD only one Washington Post subscription to cancel for my country.
Nothing to see here, just the conservative billionaires who control the media killing anything that doesn't support their narratives.
If only there was a way to cancel my subscription multiple times.

>Democracy Dies In Darkness

It used to be a warning, but it's become just a description...
WaPo bent the knee. Bezo wants in on the new robber baron era
WP credibility shot to pieces .

top_comments: So where's all the extra money going?
well surely with 83% being gone, we'll get some fraud arrests any day now...

So we killed soft power infrastructure in Africa while China is building ports and making new trade deals there. 


What is the end goal here? Sounds more like make China great again.
This election is destroying my faith in American democracy. If the winning party can destroy so many government institutions in the first three months of their term, it is not a stable system.

So, hey, maybe it doesn't matter, but, you know, it's not actually legal for the Secretary of State to get up one day and say 83% of what a government department does is not going to get done anymore because he (or Elon) doesn't feel like it should be done.

>"Welp, Jesus did say we'd always have poor people."

>-Some conservative, misinterpreting yet another passage in the Bible.

They won't be forgiven for this.  Those programs were approved by congress.  They are violating the constitution and they need to be impeached now and sent to gitmo for the rest of their miserable lives.

posts.title: Video of Indianapolis ICE arrest captures agents dragging men out of their vehicle
top_comments:
How come the cops aren't yanking the business owner out of their car for hiring (allegedly) undocumented labor?

The whole anti-immigration posture is such a stupid charade.
Wait. When did this country suspend constitution and allow warrantless search and seizure without probable cause?

Pressure is on from President Trump to meet the quotas, he's not happy with his numbers falling behind his predecessors. He already forced the acting head to step down.

The result will be violations of civil rights.
man, if i saw someone dressed like that, looking like that, I would assume that it was someone cosplaying as a cop harassing/attacking someone and would try to defend them.
Trumps Gestapo is being built.

And what’s the RAP on these two that got them pulled out of their car Felony-stop style by DHS, ATF and presumably turned over to ICE? The article states it was DHS and ATF effecting the arrest, not ICE then one of the two men was transferred to an immigration holding facility for deportation while the other was released. 
As someone who works in a law enforcement agency, this level of force rarely ever even comes out for career gang members unless there is a warrant for homicide or a violent offense. This is an incredible amount of enforcement force and resources for “no reason” so it’s quite suspicious to say the least. Note the article says there is no public record attached to the stop, does not say the man eligible for deportation did not have warrants or serious convictions .
What a bunch of racist fuckwad redneck wannabe cops.
It's a shame that stories like this are buried under the avalanche of Trump's buffoonery.
If you work for ICE and you’re doing this, it’s because you’re a nazi now
Working to provide for his handicapped, 3-year old daughter. These are some sick fucks.

posts.title: Suspected cause of Long Island wildfires was a resident making s'mores: Police
top_comments:
>Suffolk County Police Commissioner Kevin Catalina said the "operating theory" is that a fire was started at about 9:30 a.m. ET Saturday when a resident used cardboard to start a fire to make s'mores, *a confection that includes toasted marshmallows and chocolate sandwiched between graham crackers.*

I got to appreciate how the article took the time to dispassionately describe what a s'more is.
At least it wasn't something dumb, like a gender reveal party.
Who is making and eating s'mores at 9:30 in the morning?
They should have raked the smorest

>Catalina said the department has 25 arson investigators probing the blaze to determine the exact cause of the fire, but added, "So far, our investigation is pointing strongly toward an accidental origin for Saturday's fires."

They need a new category. Maybe the intent wasn't to start a forest fire, but "accidental" is a strong word for someone intentionally starting a fire in their backyard in dry, windy conditions. 

It's not like someone's phone battery blew up, or they were jumping their car and the contacts sparked or something. *Those* are accidental.
He has dishonored his marshmallow.

Cardboard? Not even a proper little fire?

Get a butane torch you guys. Or put a marshmallow on a fork and hold it over the toaster slot. Stove burner. Not hard!
Have to say that if you start a wildfire while making s’mores you have failed epically.
Maaaa there's a fire ban ? What are you talking about ?
Was it a gender reveal s’mores party?

posts.title: Crews accounted for after tanker and ship collide
top_comments:
Many years ago, a ship carrying red paint crashed into a ship carrying purple paint

Both crews were marooned.

They said: “The Marine Accident Investigation Branch has deployed a team to Grimsby following the collision of the Portuguese registered container ship Solong and the US registered oil tanker Stena Immaculate which collided in the North Sea this morning.

Career sailor (25 years) and spent a significant amount of time in the North Sea. The weather and sea state out there can get *rough* and it’s a high traffic area. I’m not trying to say it’s normal for this to happen, but it’s definitely different than two ships out in the open ocean.
Good thing is the crew is safe, bad thing is we don't know till what extent will it damage the marine life/ecosystem.
Apparently one crew member is missing.
Did not a single crew member read “How to Avoid Huge Ships”? Seems like some mandatory reading could have helped avoid this whole thing.

posts.title: Washington Post editor resigns after accusing CEO of killing column
top_comments: “Will’s decision to not run the column that I wrote respectfully dissenting from Jeff’s edict — something that I have not experienced in almost two decades of column-writing — underscores that the traditional freedom of columnists to select topics they wish to address and say what they think has been dangerously eroded,” Marcus wrote in her resignation, according to The New York Times.

If I've said it once, I've said it a thousand times. 

The true value of owning a newspaper is controlling the narrative and silencing opposition.

It doesn't matter to Jeff Bezos how many subscribers or ad clicks he has. He can *lose* money on the newspaper and it's still more valuable than not owning it. This way, he gets to drive a specific narrative specific to his own agenda while attaching a (formerly) prestigious publication to it. 

He doesn't care about journalism. He cares about his money and power.

The days of legacy Journalism are over.

>Bezos, the Amazon founder who purchased the venerable publication in 2013, told the staff last month that the opinion section would take a radical turn by "writing every day in support and defense” of “personal liberties and free markets."

"From now on you'll print *my* opinion - daily" - American oligarch and owner of the Washington Post
People need to cancel, there is no way one can trust anything from the Washington post now
I regret that I HAD only one Washington Post subscription to cancel for my country.
Nothing to see here, just the conservative billionaires who control the media killing anything that doesn't support their narratives.
If only there was a way to cancel my subscription multiple times.

>Democracy Dies In Darkness

It used to be a warning, but it's become just a description...
WaPo bent the knee. Bezo wants in on the new robber baron era
WP credibility shot to pieces .

posts.title: Man sentenced to 6 years in prison for gold bar scam that targeted Highlands Ranch woman
top_comments:
>The 23rd Judicial District Attorney's Office said Noble later handed over the two gold bars to Sagar Patel, 27, who was pretending to be an undercover agent. During the handoff, Noble recorded Patel's license plate office and turned it over to the Douglas County Sheriff's Office, leading to his arrest.

Good for her for recording the license plate. Please check in on your family members. At least the ones you like. Make sure they're not getting scammed by strangers or family.

TIPS: 

>The Denver Police Department offered these tips to keep yourself safe from scams:

>* Block unwanted calls or text messages
>* Don’t give personal or financial information over the phone or computer unless you initiated the communication with an entity you know and trust
>* Slow down. Don’t give in to pressure to act immediately.
>* Scammers like to be paid in cryptocurrency, gift card, or through peer-to-peer payment services. Never pay people you don’t know by those payment methods
>* Scammers use technology to mask or spoof their telephone numbers. Caller ID can no longer be relied upon
>* Law enforcement will never contact you and demand money

This POS tried to boo-hoo his way into a shorter sentence. Let's give credit to Judge Victoria Klingensmith for the maximum sentence of 6 years in prison. Patel is also in the US illegally and ICE put a retainer on him so he'll get deported after he completes his sentence.
The only legal way to obtain gold bars is through your job by being bribed as a Supreme Court justice

posts.title: Man sentenced to 6 years in prison for gold bar scam that targeted Highlands Ranch woman
top_comments:
>The 23rd Judicial District Attorney's Office said Noble later handed over the two gold bars to Sagar Patel, 27, who was pretending to be an undercover agent. During the handoff, Noble recorded Patel's license plate office and turned it over to the Douglas County Sheriff's Office, leading to his arrest.

Good for her for recording the license plate. Please check in on your family members. At least the ones you like. Make sure they're not getting scammed by strangers or family.

TIPS: 

>The Denver Police Department offered these tips to keep yourself safe from scams:

>* Block unwanted calls or text messages
>* Don’t give personal or financial information over the phone or computer unless you initiated the communication with an entity you know and trust
>* Slow down. Don’t give in to pressure to act immediately.
>* Scammers like to be paid in cryptocurrency, gift card, or through peer-to-peer payment services. Never pay people you don’t know by those payment methods
>* Scammers use technology to mask or spoof their telephone numbers. Caller ID can no longer be relied upon
>* Law enforcement will never contact you and demand money

This POS tried to boo-hoo his way into a shorter sentence. Let's give credit to Judge Victoria Klingensmith for the maximum sentence of 6 years in prison. Patel is also in the US illegally and ICE put a retainer on him so he'll get deported after he completes his sentence.
The only legal way to obtain gold bars is through your job by being bribed as a Supreme Court justice
